snippet: The State Department said Americans were among hostages captured by Islamist extremists in Algeria on Wednesday, in what the attackers called retaliation for France’s intervention in Mali.
abstract: Armed Islamic militants in unmarked trucks seize internationally managed natural gas field in Algeria, taking at least 20 foreign hostages, including Americans; act is apparent retaliation for French military assault on Islamist extremists in Mali, escalating that situation into potentially broader North African conflict.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and SCOTT SAYARE
byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter reported from Bamako, and Scott Sayare from Paris. Reporting was contributed by Clifford Krauss from Houston, Rick Gladstone from New York, Elisabeth Bumiller from Rome, and Alan Cowell and Steven Erlanger from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The State Department said Americans were among hostages captured by Islamist extremists in Algeria on Wednesday, in what the attackers called retaliation for France’s intervention in Mali.

headline.seo: Americans Held Hostage in Algeria Gas-Field Raid
headline.main: Militants Seize Americans and Other Hostages in Algeria
